intro: Limonium iranicum, commonly known as the Persian sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are often used in ornamental gardening due to their striking color and long-lasting blooms. Limonium iranicum is also valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in coastal and mountainous areas.
